item.title: Kelly Hoey
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: jkellyhoey.co "A connection-maker, networking strategist and expert community manager, Kelly Hoey is recognized for her “boots on the ground” leadership in the startup community by her investment in and promotion of women in tech. In 2011 Kelly co-founded Women Innovate Mobile, LLC (WIM), the first startup accelerator focused exclusively on fast-tracking the growth of early-stage mobile technology ventures with gender-diverse founding teams. In 2014, Kelly assumed an interim operations role as Chief Marketing Officer of Cuurio, a New York City based startup. Kelly continues to invest in as well as advise emerging technology companies and sits on the boards of Glimpse, JuiceLabs and Tampa Bay WaVE. She is a mentor for several startup accelerators (Straight Shot, Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator, Grand Central Tech, NYC Venture Fellows) and is an advisor to startups Cuurio, Rchery and GenoStyle. Kelly is Chief Tech Ambassador for the YWCA of NYC’s Geek Girls initiative. As managing director of WIM, Kelly was responsible for building the accelerator’s global influencer network of partnerships and connections offline and online (over 100,000 online connections, including 85,000 followers on Google+). She was also responsible for leading WIM’s marketing efforts including creating the Founders Breakfast networking events, Google+ Hangout on Air series #womenwhotech and the “Meet The Innovators” speaker series launched with Apple, Inc. in the SoHo Retail Store in February 2013. Kelly has presented in front of members of the European Commission (on building startup communities) and at conferences/events such as SXSW, IEEE Women in Leadership, PGA Championship, Women In The Boardroom, Bank of America, IIBN, MoDev, Morris County Chamber / Women In Business and Disruptors (Dublin), Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Meet The Innovators events at the Apple Stores in San Francisco, Chicago and London. In 2014, Kelly launched her “In Conversation With…” blog interviewing women entrepreneurs on SharpHeels. She’s appeared on CNBC Power Pitch, NPR and Huffington Post (Live) and has been featured in The New Yorker, Inc., FT, Forbes, Fast Company, WSJ, Business Insider, eWeek, Business Observer (FL), New York Times, Vancouver Sun and other media outlets. "

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: ​Opening Keynote:​ A Courageous Leap of Career Faith

item.title: Kristin Dormuth
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: -

item.title: Sue Clark
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Sungard Availability Services As Sr. Director, Systems Architecture for Sungard Availability Services, Sue is responsible for developing the architecture and technical strategy for Sungard Availability Services' IT systems in order to bring new technologies and methodologies for data use as part of Sungard AS' global development. She also led the effort to set up an Enterprise Data Warehouse for Sungard AS and has been involved in several big data projects for the company.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: (1) Big Data - How Big is it in Your Future?

item.title: Charlotte Bui
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: SAP Charlotte is the Senior Global Director of Design Thinking with SAP. She is responsible for Design Thinking within the SAP Sales organization and oversees the management of tools, training and communications for over 3,000 customer facing employees. Charlotte is also a Design Thinking practitioner helping SAP customers to re-imagine new possibilities for the future to stay relevant and create value through facilitation of design thinking workshops. Charlotte also manages a shared service of visual design experts to help bring creativity and powerful visualizations to our customer engagements. In the past she has launched and expanded shared services in support of both Sales and Marketing across all regions. She has over 10 years of experience in the business operations area focusing on global delivery.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mobility - Changing the Course of Enterprise Communication

item.title: Renee Chenault-Fattah
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: NBCUniversal Broadcast journalism veteran Renee Chenault-Fattah joined NBC10 in 1991.  She can currently be seen anchoring NBC10 News weekdays at 4 PM and 6 PM. Chenault-Fattah began her career as an attorney.  She practiced law in New York City for four years and remains a member of the New York Bar.  During her law career she clerked for the Hon. Damon J. Keith of the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.  She was also a litigation associate in the New York law firm of Hughes Hubbard and Reed. Earlier in her broadcasting career Chenault-Fattah was a host and field producer for New Jersey Network, a science correspondent for the Fox Network, an anchor / reporter for WTEN in Albany, New York. She later moved on to become an anchor for WXIA in Atlanta, Georgia. Chenault-Fattah is a member of various professional organizations, including The Forum of Executive Women, the National Association of Black Journalists, and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).   An active member of the community, she speaks at local schools, church congregations and civic organizations about journalism, law and ethics, and the importance of education.  She currently serves on the board of trustees for the Philadelphia Art Museum, Johns Hopkins University, and Springside Chestnut Hill Academy and has received numerous awards for her civic and professional contributions. Chenault-Fattah graduated from Johns Hopkins University with a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Political Science.  She later earned her law degree from the University of Pennsylvania and a Masters of Arts in Journalism from the University of Missouri. She lives in Philadelphia with her husband, Congressman Chaka Fattah, and their four children. Read more

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: (1) Women Helping Women Thrive: How To Support Other Women At Any Level In Your Career
(2) Closing Session:Realize That Dream - Make it Happen Now

item.title: Kathryn McCarthy
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Geeknet Kathryn (Katy) McCarthy has been CEO of Geeknet and ThinkGeek since March, 2013 and was named Chairman of the Board in July 2013. During her tenure she has led the efforts to increase brand awareness, expand exclusive product offerings, improve the site experience and customer quality, and reach new channels, including wholesale and the ThinkGeek Solutions acquisition. Prior to her promotion to CEO, Ms. McCarthy served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since January 2011. Ms. McCarthy previously spent 18 years at General Electric, Inc. As Vice President and CFO of GE Healthcare in London, UK, she contributed to delivering global growth, reducing costs and supporting mergers and acquisitions and integration activities. As Vice President of the GE Audit Staff, she led global audits and reported frequently to the audit committee and the board of directors. Previously, she was CFO of GE Transportation Systems and held leadership positions within GE Plastics in Europe and the US.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Business

item.title: Kym Grant-Horsey
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: UST Global Kym Grant-Horsey is a native of Philadelphia, Temple University graduate, who just returned to the area after 28 years. She is an Electrical Engineer where her focused on electrical design. Some of her works include reducing power consumption, by 20%, at the Kennedy Space Center and the design for the Centrust Building, now named Miami Tower. After 25 years in the engineering role, Kym transitioned to the IT arena as a consultant. In this position, Kym worked with the Brevard County School Board stationed at Ronald McNair Magnet School. At this site, she helped keep the network running, making and installing cables and software, trained administration and staff, created presentations, and anything else to promote the school as technology enhanced. Prior to leaving Florida, she worked for an organization that supported a major television network as an Uplinks Coordinator. During her career, Kym has never thought of herself as a geek instead she viewed herself as a person just doing her job. However the geek light bulb went off when one young lady’s response to her was "I sure am glad to see you!" when Kym was judging projects at the local science fair. The young lady stated that I was the only female judging computer projects. Kym continues to promote STEM by working with the Girl Scouts of USA, as a Science Fair judge and just general conversation with everyone she meets. Kym has two children, one graduating from Claflin University with a degree in Business Administration, Business Management and a minor in Spanish this May and the other daughter attends Tuskegee University majoring in Wildlife. Currently, Kym is an IT Consultant employed by UST Global where she works with clients using Java, business process management, and project management tools. The diversity of each client continues to peak her interest and therefore she embraces the challenges of a consultant.

item.title: Kim MacCormack
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: IBM Kim MacCormack holds a masters degree in Software Engineering and has over 18 years of experience in software development. She is currently a Senior Software Engineer/Architect at IBM, responsible for designing and developing UI integration strategies between open source and commercial technologies for IBM's cloud applications. In addition to being the Founder and President of CodeSherpas Inc., a Washington, DC software company, Kim has worked on over thirty web applications for various commercial, non-profit, and government clients, as both Software Engineer and Technical Lead. As an early adopter of RoR, Kim has over eight years experience with Ruby and Ruby on Rails. She is a member of the Northern Virginia Users Group, Arlington Ruby Users Group and Ladies Who Code. From 2010-2011, Kim was a bi-weekly host of the Ruby5 podcast.

item.title: Mercy Beckham
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: - Mercy is a Pre-sales Lead, Senior Consultant/Architect with over 12 years of experience in Technology Consulting, Architecture and System Design along with Technology Presales services on Content Management, and Cloud Services with recent interests in Big Data technologies. She has a strong track record of delivering complex and high value projects across industry verticals through architecture, design, development and implementation. Mercy combines creative instinct, in-depth technical skills, and a strong reputation for designing and architecting solutions.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Big Data - How Big is it in Your Future?

item.title: Darla Henning
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides 2.25MB PDF Company: Fidato Partners "Darla Henning is a forward-thinking business technologist with over 20 years of experience in Information Technology, manufacturing and marketing. During her career, she has held senior level roles at multiple Fortune 500 companies including Director-level positions at Rohm and Haas, SAP America and Chemtura Corporation. Darla is currently the ERP Practice Director for Fidato Partners, the leading provider of IT and Accounting consulting and recruiting services in the Philadelphia area. Darla’s career has been a study in ‘taking the road less traveled’. After earning her BBA in Computer Science (cum laude) from Temple University, she started as a programmer at DuPont’s Seaford, DE Nylon manufacturing plant. Instead of staying in the Information Technology department, however, she accepted a promotion into the Nylon Staple business becoming the first female from IT ever to run a manufacturing operation there. Business success in that role coupled with a solid technology foundation made Darla a perfect fit for DuPont’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) organization. She accepted multiple positions of increasing responsibility implementing SAP globally for DuPont, Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC) and then for Rohm and Haas. After earning her MBA in Leadership from Villanova University, she accepted a Sales and Marketing Director position for SAP America and her team oversaw development and go-to-market strategies for SAP’s pre-configured solutions for small and medium sized companies. Darla has always had a passion for entrepreneurship and education. She has been a leader in the development of new technologies in the object recognition and video streaming fields and has consulted with many small entertainment companies, helping structure their IT and business development strategic plans. She earned her Professional Certificate in Screenwriting from UCLA and has also been an adjunct MIS professor at Temple University."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Big Data - How Big is it in Your Future?

item.title: Vicki Boykis
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: eMoney Advisor Vicki Boykis has been working with big and small data across multiple industries (economics consulting, education, media, and finance) for over 10 years. She knew about big data before it was cool. She has previously taught Intro to SQL classes for GirlDevelopIt in Philadelphia and is involved with DataPhilly. She enjoys relational databases and Nutella.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Big Data - How Big is it in Your Future?

item.title: Joanne Lang
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: AboutOne One of Forbes Top 10 Female Entrepreneurs to Watch and the mom of four boys, AboutOne.com Founder and CEO Joanne Lang writes and speaks regularly on topics including entrepreneurship, fundraising, business development, networking, and leveraging technology to simplify life and prepare for the future. She is a former SAP cloud technology specialist. Since launching first on stage at VentureBeat DEMO, Lang has raised just over $4M in seed and series A funding. She is one of the 3% of women who have raised capital in the US and was featured in Microsoft’s documentary, CTRL+ALT+COMPETE. She’s a 2014 SmartCEO Voltage Award finalist, A Dell Founders Club Entrepreneur, and blogs for Huffington Post, The Wall Street Journal, Women 2.0, and Region’s Business. Lang is also a frequent panelist, including the NYU Women Entrepreneurs Festival, CES Living in Digital Times MommyTech Summit, Women 2.0 Founder Friday, Women in Tech Summit, and BlogHer Entrepreneurs.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Business

item.title: Rose Hamilton
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Pet360 As Pet360’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer, Rose is responsible for consumer strategy, marketplace positioning, customer engagement and merchandising across the Pet360 brand portfolio. Pet360 is an integrated media company devoted to providing pet parents the information, products and advice they need to raise happy, healthy pets. The Pet360 network reaches more than 12 million pet parents each month and powers industry leading sites such as Pet360.com, petMD.com and PetFoodDirect.com. Rose previously served as the Vice President of E-commerce for Ann Taylor and LOFT, where she oversaw online marketing strategy and analytics to drive multi-channel customer acquisition, engagement and conversion. Prior to joining Ann Taylor Stores, Rose led online marketing, merchandising and loyalty programs for a variety of leading retailers and financial services organizations, including Chico’s FAS, Best Buy, Wilsons Leather and US Bank. In 2013, Rose received The CMO Club’s Rising Star Award and was recognized as Entrepreneur of the Year by the Women in the Pet Industry Network. She sits on the Board of the Pennsylvania SPCA and holds an MBA from the University of St. Thomas Graduate School of Business.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Business

item.title: Adaora Udoji
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: outLoud Adaora is a Nigerian name meaning daughter of all. She's endeavored to make good on that promise as an entrepreneur, digital innovator, award-winning journalist, occasional angel investor and lawyer-by-training. Most recently she launched outLoud, inc., a digital and technology speaking platform. The startup focuses on marrying the best technology with notable public speaking practices to help people share what they know and move the crowds they need to be successful. Previously, she was Interim President of the award-winning media & tech startup, News Deeply which focuses on complex global issues starting with flagships wwwSyriaDeeply.org (a contextual platform hailed by Time Magazine as "The future of news.”) and www.EbolaDeeply.org. She is an award-winning journalist who has worked across broadcast and digital media platforms: television, cable, radio, and the internet at CNN, ABC News and public radio. She has written for Medium.com, MSNBC.com and Essence.com among others. Adaora is proudly associated with the startups: News Deeply, www.AmericaMeetWorld.com; Cisse Trading Co; Hubster.tv., OnMogul and Single Palm Production. She's a global nomad having put both her American and Irish passports to good use, having lived and/or worked extensively in the United States, Europe, Central Asia, the Middle East and Africa. Once upon a time she was a competitive ice skater today, she sticks to yoga and biking.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Business

item.title: Kayla O'Donnell
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: HumanKIND Pro Kayla is a writer, actor, producer, entrepreneur, and activist empowering women in entertainment and media. She has over fifteen years of experience in telecom, VOIP, and management as well as video production. Kayla is a creative and technology advocate.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mobility - Changing the Course of Enterprise Communication

item.title: Chanelle Henry
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Bluewolf I'm the UX Practitioner, advocator and defender. I am currently the Director of UX at Bluewolf, and writing a memoir of my hilarious, hypochondria-fillled adventures . With an educational background in Psychology, Computer Science, and Art Direction & Design, and a love for problem solving, I love to think and create new methodologies that help outline, encourage and propel the UX process. I teach and consult with startups about how to refine their goals, make progress, and develop a creative plan. I've worked with great clients such as United Nations World Food Programme, Western Digital, QVC, Benetech, GlaxoSmithKline, Merck, and Belk. I believe in the power of design and feel that it can honestly change the world, our attitudes, and how we interact with not only technology but each other. I hope to speak at TED one day.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mobility - Changing the Course of Enterprise Communication

item.title: Cheryl Carmel
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: SunGard Cheryl Carmel’s expertise includes ensuring information privacy by providing the guidance for security controls that match the business’s needs and gives confidence to the business clients. As an Information Security Officer for SunGard Financial Services as well as an ordinary consumer, she has a keen sense of awareness for all things cyber. Cheryl’s career has included software development, managing customer support and services prior to fully immersing in the world of Information Security. A graduate of Louisiana State University, she also received Masters Certification in Business Management from Tulane and Masters Certification in Security Management from Villanova. She holds the prestigious CISSP and CIPT professional certifications and is a member of ISC2, IAPP, ISSA, and OWASP. Cheryl enjoys providing cybersecurity awareness presentation to kids and their parents and presents through ISC2 “Safe and Secure Online” program.

item.title: Cecily Kellogg
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: Double Good Media Cecily is a natural storyteller with years of public relations, marketing, and digital strategy experience. In 2007, Cecily founded Double Good Media, a boutique agency developing content strategies to help startups, businesses, and executives sharpen their marketing messages and build thought leadership. She's a reformed blogger, a non-native Philadelphia evangelist, a mother and wife, and a writer with a book in process. She also has a slightly unhealthy relationship with social media and hair much pinker than it should be at her age.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Closing the Confidence Gap: How To Sell Yourself by Building a Digital Brand

item.title: Sara Shelton
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: CapTech Ventures Sara James Shelton is an award winning Director with CapTech Ventures specializing in Organizational Change Management, Project and Program Management. She has spoken and taught organizational change management practices all over the country for the past 15 years. Ms. Shelton is Prosci ™ certified in Change Management, a certified Project Management Professional (PMP), and a Certified Scrum Master (CSM). Ms. Shelton is also a certified Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR) demonstrating mastery of the strategic and policy-making aspects of HR management including compensation and benefits, labor relations, workforce planning and employment. She is also a MARCOM Gold winner for blogs on change management topics. Giving back to the community is critical area of Ms. Shelton's life. She has served in the Junior League of Richmond for 7 years including serving as Vice President of Community Programming, Director of Communications, Board Member and Training Institute for Leadership Impact faculty member. Additionally, she has served on the United Way Women’s Leadership Initiative Volunteer and Give Committees, and currently as a volunteer with Safe Harbor.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Women Helping Women Thrive: How To Support Other Women At Any Level In Your Career

item.title: Quiessence Phillips
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation PDF 400KB Company: Barclays Quiessence’s personal motto is “Polished Exterior, Techie Interior.” She is a Cyber Security professional with over 7 years working in the financial industry and Co-founder of a EdTech non-profit, Urban Tech Alliance. Quiessence is leading efforts in developing new STEM initiatives within NYC to redefine expectations digitally for the next generation of underrepresented youth. She is the creator of the Girltechie Campaign, a model focused on highlighting women in STEM careers through a journey-fied video series. In efforts to spread cyber security awareness and enlighten our digitized youth of the "dark alleys" of the web, she runs a workshop series called Digital Dilemmas. Quiessence is a mom, mentor, coder, hacker, strategist, and change agent. Find her on the web at www.itsquiessence.com and all the social media sites @itsquiessence.

item.title: Joni Trythall
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides View PDF Company: - Joni Trythall is a web designer, blogger, and speaker who often gets distracted drawing fruit. Her latest open source book, Pocket Guide to Writing SVG (which features a lot of fruit), was successfully funded via Kickstarter mid-2014. Her work has helped thousands of people develop the skills required to begin using SVG on the web. Prior to exploring SVG, Joni wrote extensively about CSS animations. She now regularly combines these two superpowers to - you guessed it - make a lot of animated fruit. Her writing and web sundries been featured on CSS Tricks, Sitepoint, Sidebar, Web Platform Daily, and Codepen. While she will always consider herself an advanced-beginner, Joni works to share her successes and failures exploring web technologies. She hopes that in doing so more women will realize they can do the same.

item.title: Lisa Yoder
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: Urban Outfitters Lisa Yoder works as a front-end developer at Urban Outfitters and a freelance web developer and writer. Lisa teaches WordPress classes at Scribe Video Center and volunteers as a teaching assistant with Girl Develop It. When she’s not working, Lisa is probably reading, writing, traveling, taking photos, or holding a cat.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sublime Secrets: How to Speed Up Your Workflow in Sublime Text

item.title: Brenda Dennis
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Cisco Systems With over 18 years at Cisco, Brenda Dennis is currently Senior Director of WW Sales Strategy and Transformation where she is leads sales transformation, growth and acceleration strategies for the $46B sales organization. As a member of both the Enterprise and Service Provider Operating Committees, she helps to set strategy and marshal the collective resources of the company to deliver a transformational customer experience. In her previous role as Global Sales Director, she led a 130+ person sales and engineering organization, with revenue responsibility in excess of $.6B. Before joining Cisco, Brenda spent eight years at Sprint Communications in Sales Leadership and was Sprint’s nomination for Fortune Magazine’s “Hot Shots Under 30 in Telecommunications” Brenda earned a Masters of Business Administration (MBA) from Marymount University, a Business Administration (BA) degree in International Business from Oregon State University, and studied at the University of Technology in Sydney, Australia. With a passion around developing people, creating inclusive work environments and giving back to the community, Brenda is an Executive Sponsor for the Cisco Empowered Women’s Network (CWEN) and a sought after speaker for both internal and external events. She actively gives back to the community, serves on the Boards of the Alice Paul Institute and Big Brothers Big Sisters NJ (3 year Board Chair), and is co-founder of the Hainesport Soccer Club. Brenda and her husband Doug moved to Hainesport 18 years ago to start a family and raise their three boys.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: If You Don’t Ask, You Don’t Get

item.title: Kate Green
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: Hello Wallet Kate Green is a web developer from Washington, DC. Her first computer was a Commodore 64 in the late 80s, was the only girl in her high school PASCAL class, and learned HTML during a 15 minute crash course in 1998. After getting an elementary education degree (which is actually useful!), she has spent the last 15 years doing various aspects of web design and development. She currently loves js, css preprocessors, and creating processes that help other engineers do their jobs better. In her spare time, she teaches for Girl Develop It! DC, runs, and does agility with her dogs.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Introduction to Git: Take Chances with a Safety Net

item.title: Sarah Cordivano
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation slides View Presentation-pdf Company: Azavea Sarah Cordivano is the Project Manager for the Data Analytics team at Azavea. She oversees the development and promotion of Cicero, data analytics projects and the Summer of Maps program. She is passionate about promoting the use of open data and encouraging metadata and open data standards. In her spare time, Sarah enjoys baking, reading and traveling. She is a co-organizer of GeoPhilly, a local meetup for map enthusiasts.

item.title: Stacey Mosley
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation slides View Presentation-pdf Company: City of Philadelphia Stacey is the Data Services Manager for the City of Philadelphia where she currently helps departments leverage data to improve operations, and empowers them open up their data to the public. Prior to joining the Open Data movement, she worked on the City's Vacant Property Strategy, building a data management system and processes to best utilize the City's channels of enforcement. She is a Philadelphia enthusiast and data nut who loves making things, and making things happen. Stacey earned her B.S. in Manufacturing & Design Engineering from Northwestern University and sits on the board of Young Involved Philadelphia.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mapping the Future: A Primer in Visualizing and Analyzing Open Data

item.title: Jana Veliskova
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: RJ Metrics Jana Veliskova is a programmer and UX professional who currently works as a Front-End Engineer at RJ Metrics in Philadelphia. Jana strives to create rich, accessible, and usable web applications. She thoroughly focuses on user experience and clean semantic code. She believes collaboration is the key to a better Internet and thus participates in a wide variety of meetups and conferences. She has recently spoken at UX Bar Camp DC, at Bar Camp Philly, and at Front-End Philly Meetup. In the past year, she has led the Girl Develop It book club, which encourages women to advance their career in technology. Jana has a BA in History from Cornell University and credits the supporting Philadelphia tech community for giving her opportunities for making the switch into a programming career. When she’s not creating things for the web, you can find Jana dancing Latin and Ballroom, hiking with her husband and dog, or playing a good board game.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Easy Ways to Make Your Sites More Accessible

item.title: Ashley Chapokas
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: SeatEngine After taking Girl Develop It's Web Concepts class on a considered whim, I knew I had found my avocation - writing code! I sought out every Girl Develop It and Women's Coding Collective class I could, and chewed through each programming tutorial, meetup and reading material I found over the next year. With my enthusiasm and the support of my network, I landed my first front-end development position in 2014. After some time freelancing, I am currently the lead front-end developer for SeatEngine. When I’m not serving my select freelance clients or learning some new piece of wonderful, I am the Lead Volunteer Coordinator for Girl Develop It, and the vice president of Coded by Kids.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: SMACSS: Design Patterns that Make Life Easier

item.title: Brigitte Daniel
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Wilco Electronic Systems A ‘telecom visionary’ according to Marie Claire magazine and vocal advocate for gender and cultural diversity in the tech industry, Ms. Brigitte Daniel is the Executive Vice President of Wilco Electronic Systems, Inc., her family’s African-American privately owned cable operation. For over 30 years, Wilco has provided affordable cable and technology services to low-income communities as well as commercial, governmental, and educational institutions, in Philadelphia. Over the last few years, Ms. Daniel has helped create several substantial private/public partnerships that provide innovative solutions to address the digital divide within communities in the United States, and thus, position Wilco as a digital and broadband leader, specifically working on behalf of disadvantaged communities. A 2011 Eisenhower Fellowship recipient, Brigitte traveled to India, Sri Lanka, Singapore and Malaysia to explore and cultivate global relationships in developing emerging technologies to serve and benefit underserved and low-income marketplaces in Philadelphia. In addition, Brigitte is currently serving her second term on the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Federal Advisory Committee on Diversity in the Digital Age. In June 2014, Brigitte was recognized as one of the 7 Brilliant Women in Tech according to Craigslist founder Craig Newmark, was recently featured in Marie Claire magazine as one of three profiles in its “Mogul Maintenance” column, a part of the @Work section for the September 2014 issue, and just launched an initiative called Mogulette, a program centered around educating, mentoring and empowering young women of color, between the ages of 20-25 interested in careers in entrepreneurism within technology. Ms. Daniel graduated from Spelman College in 1999 and additionally received her JD from Georgetown University Law School. In 2011, Ms. Daniel received the Business Journal's "40 under 40". In 2012, she was honored to receive the Philadelphia’s Business Journal’s Minority Leaders Award and a 2012 Women Leaders In Technology Award from the National Organization of Black Elected Legislative Women. In 2013, Ms. Daniel received a 2013 Women In Cable and Telecommunications Rising Star Award, a Next Generation of Leaders award through the office of Philadelphia Councilwoman Blondell Reynolds Brown, a “10 under 40” award from the Philadelphia Tribune, and lastly a 2013 Paragon Legacy Award from the Philadelphia chapter of the National Association of Multi-Ethnicity In Communications (NAMIC). Ms. Daniel is committed to giving back to the community and spends a significant amount of time serving as a Board Director of the Philadelphia Theatre Company, Congreso de Latinos, and the Independence Charter School.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Women Helping Women Thrive: How To Support Other Women At Any Level In Your Career

item.title: Monica S. Flores
item.dc:creator: kleljedal
item.content:encoded: Company: Ashoka Changemakers Monica S. Flores is an institutional strategist at Ashoka: Innovators for the Public. She started coding full-time in 2004, and she currently serves as in-house web developer for Changemakers.com, where she works with an agile team on Drupal redesign, project innovation, and product management. Prior to joining Ashoka, she consulted for clients as a producer and advisor on database architecture, functional specifications, wireframing, and custom reporting. Her unique skill is translating specific business needs into working solutions. She is the author of the A Successful Woman’s Handbook series, and she speaks and writes on community-building, social justice, economic development, and technology. Her current project is #STEMDaisies, where she invites women in science, technology, engineering, and math to film a 2-minute video of their workspace to share with kindergarten and 1st-grade girls. Monica is a graduate of Cornell University. She lives with her husband and three children in the metro Washington, D.C. area.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Women Helping Women Thrive: How To Support Other Women At Any Level In Your Career

item.title: Ashley Holtz
item.dc:creator: PhillyWomen
item.content:encoded:
Company: N/A <!--more-->
Ashley is a programmer and consultant in Washington, DC specializing in security and forensics. In her free time Ashley teaches women and children about technology and volunteers as the Outreach Director at DC Web Women.

item.title: Audrey Troutt
item.dc:creator: PhillyWomen
item.content:encoded:
Company: Artisan Mobile <!--more-->
Full-stack developer with over seven years' experience. Currently full-stack engineer and lead Android developer at Artisan Mobile. Passionate about clean code, healthy communities and building useful things. Organizer of N3rd Street Lunches, a monthly meetup of local nerds and startup folks in Old City.

item.title: Alexandra Hoefinger
item.dc:creator: PhillyWomen
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: Urban Outfitters A former English teacher in NYC, Alexandra transitioned to a career in programming out of an interest in creating and building projects on the web. She took her first coding class with GDI Philly in Fall 2012, and a year later started as a front-end developer at Urban Outfitters, where she mainly works with Sass, AngularJS, and other JavaScript libraries. She continues to participate in the GDI community as a teacher, TA, and student, and when she's not spending her time hacking on web projects, Alexandra works on lots of handmade craft projects and blogs about them at www.philodendron.co.

item.title: Amanda Lange
item.dc:creator: PhillyWomen
item.content:encoded:
Company: Microsoft <!--more-->
Amanda Lange is a Technical Evangelist for Microsoft, specializing in mobile development, game development, and the Azure Cloud. She has a Bachelor's degree in Computer Art from Bowling Green State University, and a Masters in Telecommunications - Digital Media, from Michigan State. She started with Microsoft in 2014, coming from the world of social, serious, and casual gaming. She keeps one foot in the academic world, occasionally providing insight on studies using games and how games effect players and vice versa. She's also an active game critic who writes reviews and interviews for the web site Tap-Repeatedly.com and her own web site SecondTruth.com. She works with the Microsoft office in Malvern and is happy to be local to Philadelphia!

item.title: Sarah Hammer
item.dc:creator: PhillyWomen
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides Company: TBA Sarah Hammer is a business leader in the investment industry with international experience in top tier investment management companies, a bulge bracket bank, and a leading global macro hedge fund. She has held various positions in investments at The Vanguard Group, PIMCO, JP Morgan Chase, BlackRock, and Tudor Investments. Her prior roles span general management, investment strategy, portfolio management & trading, hedge fund marketing, cross-disciplinary research, and portfolio analytics. Ms. Hammer is also a licensed attorney and a member of the Pennsylvania Bar Association and the American Bar Association. She is also a published author, policy advisor, and academic lecturer in the areas of finance and law. Ms. Hammer has led Women & Investing thought leadership initiatives in financial services as well as at The Wharton Club of Philadelphia and the Kilgore Society of the University of Pennsylvania Law School. She is active with a number of professional women’s organizations including the Women in Investing Network, the Financial Women’s Association, and the National Association of Women Lawyers. She is also a Harry S. Truman Scholar and leads the Truman Foundation’s Women in Leadership Forum. Ms. Hammer earned a J.D. from the University of Pennsylvania Law School, an M.B.A. from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, and a master of studies from Oxford University.
